means: 使人高兴的，令人兴奋的

sentence.Network_en: This dangerous task exhilarate his spirits.
sentence.Network_cn: 这项危险的任务使他精神振奋。

PerfectNetExp.abs: ...（盗尸的人）；rhetoric（修辞学），rhyme，rhythm；exhaust，exhibit，exhilarate（使高兴），exhort（规劝）。
词根及词缀 ... hilarious a 高兴的；热闹的 exhilarate v 使高兴，使兴奋 horrid a 可怕的.
infinite:exhaust=discrete:overlapexhilarate vt. 使高兴,使愉快a:to make cheerful
...exhaust n. 排气;v. (使)疲倦;用尽;弄空;详述exhilarate vt. 使振奋,使高兴exhort vt. 劝告

list.abs: our first parachute jump was an exhilarating experience ., 我们第一次跳伞感到兴奋莫名.
Bridget : skydiving , a dangerous bane to the countryside and emergency services , or a safe and exhilarating hobby ? well … Let's see , shall we ?布里吉特：跳伞，一个危险的，还是一种安全，愉快的嗜好？嗯…让我们看看，好吗？
We have just got some exhilarating news ., 我们刚得到一些令人振奋的消息.
We have just got some exhilarating news ., 我们刚得到一些令人振奋的消息.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Latin exhilarat- 'made cheerful', from the verb exhilarare, from ex- (expressing inducement of a state) + hilaris 'cheerful'

means.word_mean: 1. fill with sublime emotion; tickle pink (exhilarate is obsolete in this usage);

sentences.sentence: "The children were thrilled at the prospect of going to the movies"
"He was inebriated by his phenomenal success"

auth_sentence.content: It seemed greatly to delight and exhilarate him to say so.
auth_sentence.res_content: It seemed greatly to delight and exhilarate him to say so.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It seemed greatly to delight and exhilarate him to say so.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 充满欢乐的,引起大笑的
stems_affixes.word_buile: hilar高兴+ious……的→adj.充满欢乐的,引起大笑的
